junit.suite3
Class TestMultipleBrokers

java.lang.Object
  junit.framework.Assert
      junit.framework.TestCase
          junit.suite3.TestMultipleBrokers
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class TestMultipleBrokers
extends junit.framework.TestCase

This class provides a way to test in the scenario of multiple brokers with multiple swingRmiClients. * In order to run this class, rmiregistry 1099,1100,1101,1102,1103 and 1104 need to be done first.

Author:
Shuang Hou

Method Detail

testEstablishedNetwork

public void testEstablishedNetwork()
Test connection among five brokers, where these brokers are established like a star. Broker1 is the core, other four brokers connect to Broker1 seperately.

testOneBrokerConnectedOtherTwoBrokersAtSameTime

public void testOneBrokerConnectedOtherTwoBrokersAtSameTime()
                                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test connection among three brokers, where broker2 connected to broker1 already, and broker3 starts self-governed. Then let broker2 connects broker3, where connection msgs need to be injected from monitor.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

testAdvFloodInNetwork

public void testAdvFloodInNetwork()
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test advertisement flooding is correct in the network, where these brokers are established like a star. Broker1 is the core, other four brokers connect to Broker1 seperately.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

testAdvSubRoutingWithOneAdvWithMoreBrokers

public void testAdvSubRoutingWithOneAdvWithMoreBrokers()
                                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test adv/sub route in three brokers, where both broker2 and broker3 connect to broker1. Adv is sent on broker2, and sub is sent on broker3. That is, adv/sub are on uncontiguous brokers.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

testSubAdvRoutingWithOneAdvWithMoreBrokers

public void testSubAdvRoutingWithOneAdvWithMoreBrokers()
                                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test sub/adv route in three brokers, where both broker2 and broker3 connect to broker1. Adv is sent on broker2, and sub is sent on broker3. Thus adv/sub are on uncontiguous brokers. The sub will be sent first, then the adv will be sent. This is a little different from adv/sub routing.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
See Also:
testAdvSubRoutingWithOneAdvWithMoreBrokers()

public void testAdvSubRoutingWithTwoAdvsWithSameLastHopWithMoreBrokers()
                                                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test adv/sub route in multiple brokers, where adv and sub are sent on different brokers. Two advs are sent on the same broker.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

testAdvSubAdvRoutingWithTwoAdvsWithDiffLastHopWithMoreBrokers

public void testAdvSubAdvRoutingWithTwoAdvsWithDiffLastHopWithMoreBrokers()
                                                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test adv/sub/adv route in multiple brokers, where adv and sub are sent on different brokers. Two advs are sent on the different brokers. Adv1 will be sent first, sub will be sent second, adv2 will be sent last.

testUnsubscribeOnOriginalBrokerWithMultipleBrokers

public void testUnsubscribeOnOriginalBrokerWithMultipleBrokers()
                                                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test unsubscribe with multiple brokers, where broker1 is the core, broker2,3,4 connect to the broker1 seperately. clientA,B,C connect to broker2,3,4 respectively. clientA,B are publisher, clientC is subscriber. Unsubscription is sent out on clientC.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

testUnsubscribeNotOnOriginalBrokerWithMultipleBrokersWithMultiplePublishers

public void testUnsubscribeNotOnOriginalBrokerWithMultipleBrokersWithMultiplePublishers()
                                                                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test unsubscribe with multiple brokers, where broker1 is the core, broker2,3 connect to the broker1 seperately. broker4 connects to the broker3. clientA,B connect to broker2,1 respectively. clientA is publisher. clientC connect to broker3, and clientC is subscriber. clientD connects to broker4, and clientD is publisher. Unsubscription is sent out on clientB.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

testUnadvertisementWithMultipleBrokers

public void testUnadvertisementWithMultipleBrokers()
                                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Test unsubscribe with multiple brokers, where broker1 is the core, broker2,3,4 connect to the broker1 seperately. clientA,B,C connect to broker2,3,4 respectively. clientA,B are publisher, clientC is subscriber. Unadvtisement on broker2.
